summary: TestWorkflowEnvironment.create() fails in Docker environments due to test-server binary incompatibility with GLIBC versions. The testing library downloads the latest test-server release which may have incompatible system dependencies not satisfied in slim Docker images.
userImpact: Users cannot run workflow tests in Docker environments using the testing library, blocking test execution in containerized CI/CD pipelines.
rootCause: The test-server binary downloaded by @temporalio/testing v1.1.0 requires GLIBC_2.32 and GLIBC_2.34, which are not available in node:16-slim Docker image that has an older GLIBC version.
proposedFix: Pin the test-server version in the testing library instead of always downloading the latest release to avoid incompatible binaries.
resolutionDetails: Issue was resolved in v1.3.0 according to changelog. Reporter was using outdated SDK version (v1.1.0). Closer recommended upgrading to fix.
keyQuote: This new release is causing the bug... I believe the issue stems from the fact there have been a new test-server release and it is not pinned in the testing lib
